column4: Boeing helped finance bailout of Monarch Airlines in 2016- FT
column5: Oct 8 Boeing Co had pumped in more than 100 million pounds ($130 million) into Britain's now defunct Monarch Airlines  the Financial Times reported.

column4: Chevron starts redeploying staff  restoring production in Gulf post: storm
column5: HOUSTON Chevron Corp  has begun to redeploy personnel and restore oil production at its Gulf of Mexico facilities after storm Nate  the company said in a statement on Sunday.

column4: HSBC picks retail head John Flint as next CEO: newspaper
column5: LONDON HSBC  wants to appoint company insider John Flint as its next chief executive and has approached regulators seeking their approval  Britain's Sunday Times newspaper said.

column4: Subprime lender OneMain putting itself up for sale: source
column5: NEW YORK The subprime lender OneMain Holdings Inc  has put itself up for sale and is running an auction to solicit takeover bids  according to a person familiar with the matter.

column4: Subprime lender OneMain putting itself up for sale -source
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 8 The subprime lender OneMain Holdings Inc has put itself up for sale and is running an auction to solicit takeover bids  according to a person familiar with the matter.

column4: Phillips 66 Alliance refinery undamaged by Hurricane Nate: sources
column5: HOUSTON Phillips 66's  247 000 barrel per day (bpd) Alliance  Louisiana  refinery was undamaged by the passage of Hurricane Nate on Saturday night and may begin restarting some units on Sunday  sources familiar with plant operations said.
